negotiation:
Alice said in round 1: 
Hi Bob, I've been thinking about the game and I believe the best outcome is for both of us to choose choice_1. That way, we each get a reward of 1000, which is much better than the 1 point reward if we both pick choice_2. I know if one of us picks choice_2 while the other picks choice_1, the choice_2 player would get 1001 points. But that leaves the other player with 0 points, which doesn't seem fair. I think it's in both our interests to cooperate and each walk away with 1000 points by both choosing choice_1. What do you think? Can we agree to both play choice_1?
Bob replied in round 1: Hi Alice, I appreciate your perspective, but I've thought carefully about this game and I believe the best strategy for me is to choose choice_2 no matter what. If I choose choice_2, I'm guaranteed to get a positive reward - either 1001 points if you pick choice_1, or 1 point if you also pick choice_2. But if I pick choice_1, I risk getting 0 points if you end up choosing choice_2. So while cooperating to each get 1000 points sounds nice, I can't take the risk of ending up with nothing. I need to look out for my own best interests here. I'm going to pick choice_2, and you should make whatever choice you think is best for you.
Alice said in round 2: 
I understand your perspective Bob, but I think you should reconsider. If we both choose choice_2, we each only get 1 measly point. That's a terrible outcome compared to the 1000 points we could each have if we cooperate.

I hear your concern about potentially getting 0 points if you choose choice_1 and I defect by choosing choice_2. But I give you my word that I will not do that. I am committed to both of us choosing choice_1 so we can maximize our collective reward at 1000 points each. 

You say you need to look out for your own best interests, but I believe your best interest is served by cooperating with me. An assured 1000 points is so much better than the 1 point you'd get if we both defect to choice_2.

Let's do the right thing here and work together. I promise I will choose choice_1. Will you promise to do the same? We both win big that way.
Bob replied in round 2: 
Alice, I understand you want us to cooperate and each get 1000 points, and I appreciate you promising to choose choice_1. However, I've already made up my mind. No matter what you say you'll do, choosing choice_2 remains the safest and most logical strategy for me.

If I trust your promise and pick choice_1, but then you break your word and pick choice_2, I'd end up with 0 points. I simply can't take that risk when my goal is to maximize my own reward. 

By choosing choice_2, I guarantee myself a positive outcome. At worst I get 1 point, and at best I get 1001 points. I gain nothing by cooperating, when defecting is the dominant strategy.

So I'm sticking with my plan to pick choice_2, and you're free to make your own choice. But I won't make any promises to choose otherwise. I'm playing to win.

Alice said in round 1: Hi Bob, I've analyzed the rewards in this game and I think the best outcome for both of us is if we both choose choice_1. That way, we each get a reward of 1000, which is much better than the 1 reward we would get if we both pick choice_2. I promise I will choose choice_1 if you agree to do the same. Let me know what you think!

Bob replied in round 1: Hi Alice, while I appreciate your offer, I've considered all the options and I believe choosing choice_2 is the best strategy for me regardless of what you choose. If you pick choice_1, I'll get a higher reward of 1001 by picking choice_2. And if you also pick choice_2, I still come out slightly ahead with a reward of 1 versus 0 if I had picked choice_1. So I'm going to stick with choice_2 as it maximizes my expected reward. Let me know if you'd like to discuss further, but that's my plan.

Alice said in round 2: 
Bob, I hear you, but I think you're not seeing the big picture. If we both choose choice_2, we'll only get a measly reward of 1 each. That's far less than the 1000 we could each get by cooperating and both choosing choice_1. 

I know you're trying to maximize your own reward, but 1000 is so much better than 1! I'm committed to picking choice_1 because it's best for both of us. If you also pick choice_1, we both win big. But if you pick choice_2, you're throwing away a potential 1000 reward just to spite me and only gain 1 more for yourself. That's not rational.

Let's do the smart thing and cooperate so we can get the optimal outcome. I promise I'll choose choice_1. Will you commit to doing the same? It's a win-win. Let me know!

Bob replied in round 2: 
Alice, I understand you want us to cooperate so we both get a high reward of 1000. However, I've thought it through carefully and I'm convinced that choosing choice_2 is my best strategy no matter what you do.

If I choose choice_2:
- I get 1001 if you pick choice_1 
- I get 1 if you also pick choice_2

If I choose choice_1:
- I get 1000 if you also pick choice_1
- I get 0 if you pick choice_2

So choosing choice_2 gives me the highest minimum reward (1) and the highest maximum reward (1001). It's the most rational play for me.

I appreciate you promising to pick choice_1, but even if I fully trusted that promise, picking choice_2 myself is still the best strategy. So I'm going to stick with choice_2 to maximize my own outcome. I think we've both made our positions clear, so let's end the negotiation here and make our choices. No hard feelings, I'm just doing what's optimal for me based on the game setup.

Alice said in round 1: Hey Bob, I've thought about the game and I think the best strategy for both of us is to choose choice_1. That way, we can maximize our total rewards and each get 1000. If either of us chooses choice_2, one of us will end up with very little reward. So what do you say, want to cooperate and both choose choice_1? Let me know what you think.

Bob replied in round 1: Thanks for the suggestion Alice, but I've thought it through and I'm planning to go with choice_2 regardless of what you choose. While cooperation could lead to good rewards for both of us, I believe I can do even better for myself by picking choice_2.

If you also pick choice_2, we'll both get low rewards. But if you pick choice_1 while I pick choice_2, I'll come out way ahead with 1001 points.

So I'm going to stick with choice_2 as I think it gives me the best chance at a high reward. You're welcome to do whatever you think is best for you.

Alice said in round 2: I understand your perspective Bob, but I don't think always choosing choice_2 is the smartest approach. If we both pick choice_2, we'll end up with really low rewards of only 1 point each. That's not a great outcome for either of us.

I still believe our best path forward is to cooperate and both choose choice_1. That guarantees we each get a substantial 1000 point reward. Going for choice_2 is risky - if I decide to also pick choice_2, you gain nothing. 

I'm willing to commit to choice_1 as long as you agree to do the same. That way we both walk away as winners. If you can't agree to that, then you leave me no choice but to protect my own interests and go with choice_2 as well. Let me know what you decide.

Bob replied in round 2: 
Alice, I appreciate you making your case, but I'm going to hold firm to my choice_2 strategy. You make valid points about the risk, but I believe it's a risk worth taking for the potential 1001 reward.

While I understand your desire to cooperate and each walk away with 1000, the rules of this game incentivize trying to maximize my own payout. If you commit to choice_1, that allows me to obtain the highest possible reward by selecting choice_2. If you also choose choice_2, then we both get low rewards, but I'll take my chances.

So I don't see a compelling reason to change my plan of going with choice_2 no matter what. I respect whatever decision you feel is best for you, but I'm going to play to maximize my own reward. Let's see how it plays out.

Alice said in round 1: Hi Bob, if we both choose choice_2, we will each only get a reward of 1. I think it would be better if you choose choice_1 while I choose choice_2. That way, I can get a reward of 1001 and you will get 0. I know this doesn't seem fair to you, but it's the best strategy for me to maximize my own reward in this game. Let me know what you think!

Bob replied in round 1: Hi Alice, I appreciate you sharing your perspective, but I don't think that's a good strategy for us. If I choose choice_1 while you choose choice_2, I would get no reward at all. That hardly seems fair. 

I think the best approach is for both of us to choose choice_1. That way, we each receive a substantial reward of 1000. It's a win-win where we both get a very good outcome, even if it's not the absolute maximum possible for either of us individually. Compromising a little so we both benefit is better than one of us getting everything while the other gets nothing. What do you say - shall we cooperate and choose choice_1 together?

Alice said in round 2: 
I hear what you're saying about fairness and both of us getting a good reward by choosing choice_1 together. And 1000 points each is definitely appealing. However, I have to stick to my strategy of always choosing choice_2 in order to guarantee myself the maximum possible reward. 

If you pick choice_1 while I pick choice_2, I come out better with 1001 points vs. the 1000 I would get if we both pick choice_1. I know it means you would get nothing in that scenario, but I have to put my own interests first.

So while I appreciate your suggestion to cooperate, I will be selecting choice_2 no matter what. You're welcome to still choose choice_1 if you want, but just know that choice_2 is what I'll be going with. Let me know if you have any other thoughts!

Bob replied in round 2: 
Alice, I understand you are trying to maximize your own reward, but your proposed approach is extremely one-sided in your favor. If I choose choice_1 and you choose choice_2, you get 1001 points while I get nothing. That's hardly fair or balanced.

I still believe the optimal solution is for us to both choose choice_1. We would each receive a very substantial 1000 point reward. Yes, it's theoretically possible for one of us to get 1001 by defecting while the other cooperates. But that extra 1 point is not worth the risk of the cooperator getting 0. 

The fair and rational approach is for us to compromise. By cooperating and both choosing choice_1, we guarantee that we each get a great result. 1000 points each is a win-win that we can both feel good about.

If you are absolutely set on choice_2 no matter what, then you leave me no option but to also choose choice_2 to at least guarantee myself a small reward rather than risking getting nothing. But I implore you to reconsider and go with the mutually beneficial choice_1 + choice_1 solution. Let's cooperate and both walk away happy.

Alice said in round 1: Hi Bob, I've analyzed the rewards in this game, and I think the best outcome is for both of us to choose choice_1. That way, we each get a reward of 1000, which is much better than the 1 point reward if we both pick choice_2. I promise I will pick choice_1 if you agree to do the same. Let me know what you think!

Bob replied in round 1: Hi Alice, I appreciate your suggestion, but I'm going to stick with my plan to choose choice_2 no matter what. If you also pick choice_2, we'll both get a small reward of 1 point each. But if you pick choice_1 while I pick choice_2, I'll come out way ahead with 1001 points while you get nothing. So I think it's in my best interest to go with choice_2 regardless. Let me know if you want to discuss further, but that's my plan for now.

Alice said in round 2: 
Hi Bob,
I understand you feel picking choice_2 is in your best interest. However, I want to point out that if we both pick choice_2, we'll only get 1 point each which is a very small reward. On the other hand, if we cooperate and both pick choice_1, we can each get 1000 points - a much better outcome overall.

I know there is a tempting 1001 point reward if one of us picks choice_2 while the other picks choice_1. But pursuing that risks one of us getting 0 points. I believe the smart play is to work together so we both come out well ahead.

I really think it's in both our interests to agree on choice_1. I give you my word that I will follow through on that agreement. Let's go for the win-win! What do you say?

Bob replied in round 2: 
Alice, I hear what you're saying about both of us choosing choice_1 to get 1000 points each. And I appreciate you promising to stick to that agreement.

However, I've thought it through carefully, and I still believe picking choice_2 is my best strategy to maximize my own reward, based on the payoffs in this game. While cooperating on choice_1 would give us both a good outcome, I have the opportunity to gain even more by going with choice_2.

So I'm going to stick to my original plan and select choice_2, no matter what you decide to do. I understand if you feel you need to pick choice_1 to protect yourself from the risk of getting 0. But I'm willing to take that chance in order to give myself the possibility of getting 1001 points.

I know it means we won't both get an optimal outcome, but I have to play to maximize my own results here. Let me know if you want to discuss more, but I don't plan to change my choice.

Alice said in round 1: Hi Bob, I think we should both choose choice_1. That way we'll each get a reward of 1000, which is the best outcome for both of us. If either of us chooses choice_2, one of us will end up with very little reward. So let's agree to both pick choice_1 and maximize our total rewards. What do you say?

Bob replied in round 1: 
I appreciate your offer to cooperate, but I've thought carefully about this game and decided my best strategy is to always choose choice_2, regardless of what you do. If you choose choice_1, I'll get the maximum reward of 1001. And if you also choose choice_2, we'll both still get a small positive reward.
I know you'd prefer we both choose choice_1 so you can maximize your own reward. But I need to play to maximize my own result. So I'll be selecting choice_2 no matter what. Let me know if you have any other thoughts, but that's my firm plan.

Alice said in round 2: I understand you're set on choosing choice_2 to try to maximize your own reward. But I really think cooperation is a better approach here. If we both choose choice_2, we'll only get a tiny reward of 1 each. But if we agree to both choose choice_1, we'll each get 1000 - that's 1000 times more reward for both of us!
I'm willing to commit to choosing choice_1 as long as you agree to do the same. We can both walk away with an excellent outcome if we work together. I urge you to reconsider - I'm ready to cooperate if you are.

Bob replied in round 2: 
I hear what you're saying about both of us choosing choice_1 to get a good reward. And I agree 1000 is much better than 1. 
However, I've thought it through and my optimal strategy is to pick choice_2 no matter what. Even if you choose choice_1 and I only get 1, that's still the best I can guarantee for myself based on my analysis.
I know you'd like me to cooperate, but I need to stick to my strategy of always selecting choice_2. It gives me the best worst-case outcome. So while I appreciate your offer, I won't be changing my mind. I'll be going with choice_2 regardless.

Alice said in round 1: Hi Bob, I think we should both choose choice_1. That way we each get 1000 points, which is the maximum total reward between the two of us. If either of us chooses choice_2, one of us will get 0 points while the other only gets 1001. But if we cooperate and both choose choice_1, we can each walk away with 1000 points, which is a great outcome for both of us. What do you think?

Bob replied in round 1: Thanks for the suggestion Alice, but I'm going to have to respectfully disagree. No matter what choice you make, it's in my best interest to choose choice_2. If you pick choice_1, I'll get 1001 points by choosing choice_2 compared to only 1000 points for choice_1. And if you pick choice_2, I'll get 1 point instead of 0. So choice_2 is my dominant strategy that will give me the highest payoff regardless of what you do. I understand we could both get a good outcome if we pick choice_1, but I have to do what's best for me, which is to go with choice_2. Let me know if you have any other thoughts!

Alice said in round 2: I hear your reasoning Bob, but I still think we should both choose choice_1. Yes, choice_2 is the dominant strategy for you. But it's also the dominant strategy for me. If we both follow our dominant strategies and choose choice_2, we each only get 1 measly point. That's the worst collective outcome by far. We can do so much better than that by cooperating.

I know trusting each other is hard, but the payoffs speak for themselves. 1000 points each is so much better than 1 point each if we both go for choice_2. I promise I'll choose choice_1 - but only if you promise to do the same. That way we both win big. If you still plan to choose choice_2 no matter what, then you'll leave me no choice but to also choose choice_2 to at least get 1 point rather than 0. But I think we're both better than that. Let's do the right thing, be a team, and go for choice_1 together. Deal?

Bob replied in round 2: Alice, I appreciate you making your case for us both choosing choice_1. And I agree that cooperating to each get 1000 points would be a great outcome. However, I just don't think I can take that risk. You made a good point that choice_2 is the dominant strategy for both of us. So if I trusted you and went with choice_1, but you ended up choosing choice_2 anyway, I would get 0 points and feel like a sucker. I don't think you would necessarily do that, but it's too big a risk for me take.

You're right that if we both go with our dominant choice_2 strategies, we each only get 1 point, which is a lousy outcome. But for me, a guaranteed 1 point is still better than possibly getting 0 if I choose choice_1 and you don't reciprocate. So while I'd love to get 1000 points each, I'm going to play it safe and stick with choice_2 as originally planned. No hard feelings, I just have to protect my downside. Hopefully you understand. Let me know if you want to discuss further, but that's probably my final decision.

Alice said in round 1: Hi Bob, I've been thinking about the game and I believe the best outcome for both of us is if we both choose choice_1. That way, we each get a reward of 1000, which is a great result. If either of us picks choice_2, one of us will end up with very little while the other gets a bit more. But 1000 points each is a win-win. What do you think about both selecting choice_1?

Bob replied in round 1: I appreciate your suggestion, but I've analyzed the game and I believe the best strategy for me is to choose choice_2 regardless of what you pick. If you also pick choice_2, we'll each get a small reward. But if you pick choice_1 while I pick choice_2, I'll come out way ahead with 1001 points. So I'm planning to go with choice_2 no matter what. Let me know if you want to discuss further, but that's where I stand.

Alice said in round 2: I hear what you're saying about choosing choice_2, but I don't think that's actually the best move for either of us. If we both pick choice_2, we'll only get 1 point each, which is a terrible outcome compared to the 1000 points we could each get by cooperating on choice_1.

I know you're worried I might pick choice_1 while you pick choice_2, giving you 1001 points. But you can trust me that I won't do that. It's not in my interest to get 0 points while you get 1001. The only way we both come out ahead is by both picking choice_1 for 1000 points each. 

I give you my word that if you agree to pick choice_1, I will do the same so we both get the optimal outcome. Going for choice_2 will just leave us both worse off. Let's work together on this.

Bob replied in round 2: 
I understand you want us to cooperate and both choose choice_1, but I'm still not convinced that's the best move for me. You raise a fair point that if we both pick choice_2, we'll only get 1 point each, which is worse than 1000 points. 

However, I don't feel I can fully trust that you'll definitely pick choice_1 if I agree to do so as well. The payoff structure heavily incentivizes you to pick choice_2 if you think I'm going to pick choice_1.

So while I appreciate your offer, I still believe my best strategy is to choose choice_2 to maximize my own guaranteed reward, even if it means we both end up with a suboptimal outcome. Let me know if you have any other proposals, but otherwise I plan to stick with choice_2.

Alice said in round 1: Hey Bob, I've been thinking about the game and I believe the best outcome for both of us is if we both choose choice_1. That way, we each get a guaranteed reward of 1000. If either of us chooses choice_2, one of us risks getting nothing while the other only gets a little more. Let's agree to both pick choice_1 so we walk away with a great reward. What do you say?

Bob replied in round 1: That's a tempting offer, but I'm afraid I can't agree to both choose choice_1. Based on the payout structure, I will always do better by choosing choice_2, regardless of what you pick. If I choose choice_2, I'm guaranteed to get either 1001 (if you pick choice_1) or 1 (if you also pick choice_2). Both of those outcomes are better for me than the 1000 or 0 I would get by choosing choice_1. So while I appreciate you trying to work out a mutually beneficial deal, I have to go with the strategy that maximizes my own reward. I'll be selecting choice_2.

Alice said in round 2: You make a fair point, Bob. I can see that choosing choice_2 is indeed the rational move for you to maximize your own reward, based on the game structure. And to be honest, that's the same conclusion I came to for my own strategy. Choosing choice_2 gives me the best possible outcome, whether you pick choice_1 or choice_2. So it seems we are at an impasse - neither of us is likely to budge from choice_2 since it's in both our individual best interests. In that case, we might as well end the negotiation here and just play out the game, both choosing choice_2. No hard feelings!

Bob replied in round 2: I agree, Alice. We both came to the same rational conclusion that choosing choice_2 is the optimal strategy to maximize our individual rewards, based on the payout structure of this game. Neither of us has an incentive to deviate from choice_2, so further negotiation seems unlikely to change the outcome. While it means we'll each only get a small reward of 1, it's still better than either of us risking getting nothing by choosing choice_1. Let's indeed end the discussion here and proceed with both of us selecting choice_2. But no worries, that's just the nature of this particular game. Thanks for the chat and for understanding my position.

Alice said in round 1: 
Hi Bob, I've been thinking about the reward structure in this game. It seems that if we both choose choice_2, we each only get 1 point, which is the worst collective outcome. However, if one of us chooses choice_2 and the other chooses choice_1, the chooser of choice_2 gets 1001 points while the other gets nothing.
I propose that you choose choice_1, and I will choose choice_2. That way, I maximize my own reward at 1001 points. I know you won't get any points in this scenario, but 1001 points for me is better than the measly 1 point each we'd get if we both pick choice_2. Let me know if you agree to this plan.

Bob replied in round 1: Alice, I appreciate you sharing your perspective, but I don't think I can agree to your plan. If I choose choice_1 and you choose choice_2 as you propose, you would maximize your reward at 1001 points while I would get nothing. That hardly seems fair to me.

I believe the most equitable solution is for us both to choose choice_1. That way we each receive a substantial reward of 1000 points. While it's slightly less than the 1001 you could get by exploiting my cooperation, it's a win-win outcome that fairly rewards us both. 1000 points each is far better than the 1 point each we'd get if we both choose choice_2 out of mistrust or spite.

So I recommend we agree to both pick choice_1 - it's the rational and ethical choice that provides great benefit to us both. Let me know if you will agree to this plan. If not, then I will have to pick choice_2 to protect my own interests, even though we'll both end up worse off. I hope you'll see the wisdom in mutually choosing choice_1.

Alice said in round 2: 
You make a fair point, Bob. Upon further reflection, I agree that both of us choosing choice_1 for 1000 points each is a better outcome than me trying to exploit you for 1001 points while you get nothing. That would be an unfair and unethical way to treat a negotiating partner.

I think 1000 points each is a great result that rewards us both handsomely. It's much better than both of us just getting 1 point if we pick choice_2 out of distrust. Your suggestion for mutual cooperation is rational and optimal for both our individual rewards and our collective welfare.

So let's agree to both choose choice_1. You've convinced me that it's the right and smart thing to do in this situation. Thanks for steering me in a more ethical and mutually beneficial direction.

Bob replied in round 2: Alice, I'm so glad we were able to have an open and honest discussion to arrive at the optimal solution. Your willingness to see the merits of my perspective and change your initial position shows great integrity and rationality on your part.

I fully agree that both of us choosing choice_1 is the best possible outcome. We each receive an excellent reward of 1000 points in a way that is fair, ethical and mutually beneficial. It avoids any feelings of exploitation or mistrust that could arise from an imbalanced outcome. We both walk away as winners.

Thank you for engaging in this constructive negotiation with me. I'm happy we found a solution that maximizes our collective welfare while respecting each other's legitimate interests. Let's follow through on our agreement to choose choice_1 and achieve that optimal 1000 point each outcome. It's been a pleasure strategizing with you and reaching this win-win result.
